trans-unit.source: Clone your StorSimple volume | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Clone your StorSimple volume | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes the different clone types and when to use them, and explains how you can use a backup set to clone an individual volume.
trans-unit.target: Describes the different clone types and when to use them, and explains how you can use a backup set to clone an individual volume.

trans-unit.source: Use the StorSimple Manager service to clone a volume
trans-unit.target: Use the StorSimple Manager service to clone a volume

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager service **Backup Catalog** page displays all the backup sets that are created when manual or automated backups are taken.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager service **Backup Catalog** page displays all the backup sets that are created when manual or automated backups are taken.

trans-unit.source: You can use this page to list all the backups for a backup policy or a volume, select or delete backups, or use a backup to restore or clone a volume.
trans-unit.target: You can use this page to list all the backups for a backup policy or a volume, select or delete backups, or use a backup to restore or clone a volume.

trans-unit.source: Backup catalog page
trans-unit.target: Backup catalog page

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how you can use a backup set to clone an individual volume.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how you can use a backup set to clone an individual volume.

trans-unit.source: It also explains the difference between *transient* and *permanent* clones.
trans-unit.target: It also explains the difference between *transient* and *permanent* clones.

trans-unit.source: Create a clone of a volume
trans-unit.target: Create a clone of a volume

trans-unit.source: You can create a clone on the same device, another device, or even a virtual machine by using a local or a cloud snapshot.
trans-unit.target: You can create a clone on the same device, another device, or even a virtual machine by using a local or a cloud snapshot.

trans-unit.source: To clone a volume
trans-unit.target: To clone a volume

trans-unit.source: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the **Backup catalog** tab and select a backup set.
trans-unit.target: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the **Backup catalog** tab and select a backup set.

trans-unit.source: Expand the backup set to view the associated volumes.
trans-unit.target: Expand the backup set to view the associated volumes.

trans-unit.source: Click and select a volume from the backup set.
trans-unit.target: Click and select a volume from the backup set.

trans-unit.source: Clone a volume
trans-unit.target: Clone a volume

trans-unit.source: Click **Clone** to begin cloning the selected volume.
trans-unit.target: Click **Clone** to begin cloning the selected volume.

trans-unit.source: In the Clone Volume wizard, under **Specify name and location**:
trans-unit.target: In the Clone Volume wizard, under **Specify name and location**:

trans-unit.source: Identify a target device.
trans-unit.target: Identify a target device.

trans-unit.source: This is the location where the clone will be created.
trans-unit.target: This is the location where the clone will be created.

trans-unit.source: You can choose the same device or specify another device.
trans-unit.target: You can choose the same device or specify another device.

trans-unit.source: If you choose a volume associated with other cloud service providers (not Azure), the dropdown list for the target device will only show physical devices.
trans-unit.target: If you choose a volume associated with other cloud service providers (not Azure), the dropdown list for the target device will only show physical devices.

trans-unit.source: You cannot clone a volume associated with other cloud service providers on to a virtual device.
trans-unit.target: You cannot clone a volume associated with other cloud service providers on to a virtual device.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Make sure that the capacity required for the clone is lower than the capacity available on the target device.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Make sure that the capacity required for the clone is lower than the capacity available on the target device.

trans-unit.source: Specify a unique volume name for your clone.
trans-unit.target: Specify a unique volume name for your clone.

trans-unit.source: The name must contain between 3 and 127 characters.
trans-unit.target: The name must contain between 3 and 127 characters.

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow icon
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow icon

trans-unit.source: arrow-icon
trans-unit.target: arrow-icon

trans-unit.source: to proceed to the next page.
trans-unit.target: to proceed to the next page.

trans-unit.source: Under **Specify hosts that can use this volume**:
trans-unit.target: Under **Specify hosts that can use this volume**:

trans-unit.source: Specify an access control record (ACR) for the clone.
trans-unit.target: Specify an access control record (ACR) for the clone.

trans-unit.source: You can add a new ACR or choose from the existing list.
trans-unit.target: You can add a new ACR or choose from the existing list.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon

trans-unit.source: check-icon
trans-unit.target: check-icon

trans-unit.source: to complete the operation.
trans-unit.target: to complete the operation.

trans-unit.source: A clone job will be initiated and you will be notified when the clone is successfully created.
trans-unit.target: A clone job will be initiated and you will be notified when the clone is successfully created.

trans-unit.source: Click **View Job** to monitor the clone job on the **Jobs** page.
trans-unit.target: Click **View Job** to monitor the clone job on the **Jobs** page.

trans-unit.source: After the clone job is completed:
trans-unit.target: After the clone job is completed:

trans-unit.source: Go to the **Devices** page, and select the **Volume Containers** tab.
trans-unit.target: Go to the **Devices** page, and select the **Volume Containers** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the volume container that is associated with the source volume that you cloned.
trans-unit.target: Select the volume container that is associated with the source volume that you cloned.

trans-unit.source: In the list of volumes, you should see the clone that was just created.
trans-unit.target: In the list of volumes, you should see the clone that was just created.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Monitoring and default backup are automatically disabled on a cloned volume.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Monitoring and default backup are automatically disabled on a cloned volume.

trans-unit.source: A clone that is created this way is a transient clone.
trans-unit.target: A clone that is created this way is a transient clone.

trans-unit.source: For more information about clone types, see [Transient vs. permanent clones](#transient-vs.-permanent-clones).
trans-unit.target: For more information about clone types, see [Transient vs. permanent clones](#transient-vs.-permanent-clones).

trans-unit.source: This clone is now a regular volume, and any operation that is possible on a volume will be available for the clone.
trans-unit.target: This clone is now a regular volume, and any operation that is possible on a volume will be available for the clone.

trans-unit.source: You will need to configure this volume for any backups.
trans-unit.target: You will need to configure this volume for any backups.

trans-unit.source: Transient vs. permanent clones
trans-unit.target: Transient vs. permanent clones

trans-unit.source: You can clone a specific volume from a backup set.
trans-unit.target: You can clone a specific volume from a backup set.

trans-unit.source: A clone created in this way is a *transient* clone.
trans-unit.target: A clone created in this way is a *transient* clone.

trans-unit.source: The transient clone will have references to the original volume and will use that volume to read while writing locally.
trans-unit.target: The transient clone will have references to the original volume and will use that volume to read while writing locally.

trans-unit.source: This could result in slow performance, especially if the cloned volume is large.
trans-unit.target: This could result in slow performance, especially if the cloned volume is large.

trans-unit.source: After you take a cloud snapshot of a transient clone, the resulting clone will be a *permanent* clone.
trans-unit.target: After you take a cloud snapshot of a transient clone, the resulting clone will be a *permanent* clone.

trans-unit.source: The permanent clone is independent and doesn’t have any references to the original volume that it was cloned from.
trans-unit.target: The permanent clone is independent and doesn’t have any references to the original volume that it was cloned from.

trans-unit.source: For faster performance, we recommend that you create permanent clones.
trans-unit.target: For faster performance, we recommend that you create permanent clones.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios for transient and permanent clones
trans-unit.target: Scenarios for transient and permanent clones

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe example situations in which transient and permanent clones can be used.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe example situations in which transient and permanent clones can be used.

trans-unit.source: Item-level recovery with a transient clone
trans-unit.target: Item-level recovery with a transient clone

trans-unit.source: You need to recover a one-year-old Microsoft PowerPoint presentation file.
trans-unit.target: You need to recover a one-year-old Microsoft PowerPoint presentation file.

trans-unit.source: Your IT administrator identifies the specific backup from that time frame, and then filters the volume.
trans-unit.target: Your IT administrator identifies the specific backup from that time frame, and then filters the volume.

trans-unit.source: The administrator then clones the volume, locates the file that you are looking for, and provides it to you.
trans-unit.target: The administrator then clones the volume, locates the file that you are looking for, and provides it to you.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, a transient clone is used.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, a transient clone is used.

trans-unit.source: Testing in the production environment with a permanent clone
trans-unit.target: Testing in the production environment with a permanent clone

trans-unit.source: You need to verify a testing bug in the production environment.
trans-unit.target: You need to verify a testing bug in the production environment.

trans-unit.source: You create a clone of the volume in the production environment.
trans-unit.target: You create a clone of the volume in the production environment.

trans-unit.source: For increased performance, you need to take a cloud snapshot of this clone.
trans-unit.target: For increased performance, you need to take a cloud snapshot of this clone.

trans-unit.source: The cloned volume is now independent, which results in faster performance.
trans-unit.target: The cloned volume is now independent, which results in faster performance.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, a permanent clone is used.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, a permanent clone is used.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to [restore a StorSimple volume from a backup set](storsimple-restore-from-backup-set.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to [restore a StorSimple volume from a backup set](storsimple-restore-from-backup-set.md).
